title: CTRL0000916110 - Transcribed Interview of Samuel Armes, (July 18, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The interview in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 2:03 p.m.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
This is a transcribed interview of Mr. Samuel
Armes, conducted by the House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
on the United States Capitol pursuant to House Resolution 503.
At this time, I'd ask the witness to please state your full name and spell your last
hank you very much, Mr. Armes.
So this will be a staff-led interview, and members, if they join, are allowed to ask

wait until each question is completed before you begin your response, Mr. Armes, and we

know, on these virtual interviews, it can really be hard for the stenographers to hear us if

The stenographer also cannot record nonverbal responses, such as shaking your
head, so it is important that you answer each question with an audible, verbal response.
And we ask that you provide complete answers based on your best recollection.
If the question is not clear -- and that happens -- please just ask for clarification.

I was a -- I was not a government employee.
were both programs through USF, through the intel program that I was at.
